title: Establishes the mature worker business initiative within the state office of the aging to encourage businesses to recruit, retain and retrain mature workers
summary: Establishes the mature worker business initiative within the state office for the aging to encourage businesses to recruit, retain and retrain mature workers; describes the general powers and duties of the mature worker business initiative council.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2178

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the elder law and the economic development law, in relation to
establishing the mature worker business initiative

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF THE BILL:

Establishes a mature worker business initiative within the state
office for the aging. Creates a council to develop and implement a
program to develop strategies and protocols for identifying
businesses that are offering arrangements to employees that are
designed to recruit and retain mature workers, to develop and certify
employers who are "mature worker friendly employers", and design and
implement a marketing outreach plan for encouraging the participation
of businesses in: the program.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

Amends the elder law, creating a new Article IV called the mature
worker employment training program. Section 301 establishes the
mature worker business initiative. Section 302 describes the general
powers and duties of the mature worker business initiative council.
Section 100 of the economic development law is amended by adding a
new subdivision 18-h encouraging the commissioner to work with the
director to establish rules, procedures, and regulations to implement
the mature worker business initiative.

JUSTIFICATION:

The demographic projections are showing clearly that older workers
will continue to make up a rapidly growing percentage of the work
force. This growth represents the fact that the population as a whole
is getting older due to several factors, including the aging of the
Baby Boom generation,' lower birth rates for generations immediately
following the baby boom longer life expectancies and younger
generations leaving the state to work elsewhere. Businesses across
the state will feel the impact of the retirement of the baby boomers
and will no doubt be looking at employing, or retaining older workers
as the demand for workers will increase. This legislation establishes
a mature worker business initiative within the state office for the
aging and creates a council to develop and implement a program to
develop strategies and, protocols for identifying businesses that are
offering arrangements to employees that are designed to recruit and
retain mature workers, to develop and certify employers who are
"mature worker friendly employers", and design and implement a
marketing outreach plan for encouraging the participation of
businesses in the program.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:

S.3061 - 2007-08: Referred to Aging, Reported and Committed to Finance
S.2025 - 2009-10: Referred to Aging, Reported and Committed to Finance

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

Immediately.
